raw_comment: I noticed that students with a legacy and rich parents were the most likely to be admitted to these elite schools. I wonder why legacy mattered so much even if students had rich parents and the same test scores. This can relate to my community since my brother is applying to Dartmouth and Cornell. I wonder if he will get in since my family is middle class and does not have legacies at either school. A catchy headline would be: "Colleges: All men are created equal?"
ace_sentences: I noticed that some students have a legacy.
I noticed that some students have rich parents.
I noticed that students with a legacy and rich parents are most likely to be admitted to elite schools.
Some students have the same test scores.
I wonder why a legacy matters so much even if a student has rich parents.
I wonder why a legacy matters so much even if a student has the same test scores as another student.
This situation relates to my community.
My brother is applying to Dartmouth.
My brother is applying to Cornell.
I wonder if my brother will be admitted to Dartmouth.
I wonder if my brother will be admitted to Cornell.
My family does not have a legacy at Dartmouth.
My family does not have a legacy at Cornell.
The headline is: "Colleges: All men are created equal?"
